page.title: 09Manchester to Haughton Green
page.content: The Anderson family moved to Haughton Green from Miles Platting in 1964. They found Haughton Green very quiet at first and very open and green after the overcrowded conditions of their former environment.Their new house was on the edge of the{Manchester {Overspill Estate}and it overlooked Hulme's Wood.Their 4 daughters were then aged from 7 weeks to 8 years and all have grown up here,attending Corrie Primry school and Two Trees Secondary.Mr.Anderson is a postman in Manchester.Mrs.Anderson works locally as a primary school secratary.They enjoy living so close to the woods and the house has a large garden,3 bedrooms and a roomy, well-equiped kitchen.They are now buying the house. The family all agree that moving to{ {Haughton Green}was a very good idea.
